title: Soursop Production Techniques- A training for Belize

subtasks: Prepare to collect pollen grain from male flowers
Identify male flowers with anthers containing yellow pollen grains
Transfer pollen grain from male flower brush to female flower stigma
Open female flower to expose the stigma using one hand
Gently touch the brush with pollen grain to the stigma
Wait 60 days after pollination for the fruit to develop
Apply protective bags (nets) to the fruit to prevent seed borer infestation
Maintain protection for at least two more months

tasks.task: Pruning Soursop Trees for Fruit Production
subtasks: Regular pruning to manage tree canopy
Remove excess branches in the center to improve sunlight and air circulation
Stimulate new fruiting sites by pruning
Encourage continuous flower and fruit production
Observe skin color and spine texture for ripeness
Use shears to cut fruit near the stalk, leaving the stalk attached
Prune the site to promote new flower bud development
Incorporate both organic and chemical fertilizers or use only organic matter
Collect and compost pruned leaves and branches
Apply warm compost and biofertilizers around the trees
